reviews.review_msg: Nice and clearly does lots of good research and work just not a good prof. Unclear criteria on all assignments including discussion posts, spelling/grammar errors in communication, minimal feedback given on work. Felt like our course theme was vague and not related to sustainable development which sucked. Be sure to go to class so ur not lost
she can sometimes be unclear, but she is the kindest and most caring prof ive ever had!

Dr. Enns is a well-versed, knowledgable, and caring prof. I enjoyed her connections to concrete city issues when working within her course. She provided a lot of opportunity for hands-on work, something that might often be missing from the classroom context. She's a tad disorderly in her lecture/communication but she is always welcoming to connect.

Professor Enns is a good example of why SFU is ranked in the 350 range of universities. She's a wonderfully nice person and has a solid professional record, however, she is a terrible prof. The rubric is unclear, feedback is unclear, her grammar is off for assignments, in general, it's a very poorly designed class.

Dr. Enns is really nice but definitely a difficult prof. She is super unorganized and her outline is unclear. I literally never really knew what she wanted from us at all. Likewise, her marking is super difficult which sucks because we never knew exactly what she wanted from us or would change it. It was nice having guests join us most classes.
